title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch multiple satellites for the NRO from Vandenberg Space Force Base
summary: The mission is described as the second launch supporting the National Reconnaissance Office’s (NRO) “proliferated architecture.” Liftofff from Vandenberg Space Force Base no earlier than 8:14 p.m. PDT (11:14 p.m. EDT, 0314 UTC).

title: Starliner landing now on indefinite hold for more tests, but NASA insists crew not ‘stranded’ in space
summary: The problem for NASA and Boeing is that the Starliner's service module, which houses the helium lines, thrusters and other critical systems, is discarded before re-entry and burns up in the atmosphere. Engineers will not be able to study the hardware after the fact and as a result, they want to collect as much data as possible before NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams head home.

title: Prize winner wants to detect asteroids coming from sun’s direction
summary: Ground-based telescopes ignore “a huge swath” of the inner solar system because the sky is simply too bright

title: Starliner to remain on ISS for more thruster tests
summary: NASA and Boeing plan to keep the CST-100 Starliner spacecraft at the International Space Station well into July to conduct additional tests, while emphasizing its two-person crew is not “stranded” in space.

title: House Passes FY2025 Defense Appropriations Bill on Largely Partisan Lines
summary: The House passed the FY2025 Defense Appropriations bill today on largely partisan lines, primarily because of social policy provisions that were included. The bill cuts almost $1 billion from the […]

title: Military space trackers to keep public informed on Starlink satellite reentries
summary: U.S. Space Command says it is “working with SpaceX to safely track the orbit lowering and reentry of Starlink satellites”

title: NASA Awards Contract for Infrared Telescope Facility Operations
summary: NASA has selected the University of Hawaii in Honolulu to maintain and operate the agency’s Infrared Telescope Facility (IRTF) on Mauna Kea in Hilo, Hawaii. The Management and Operations of NASA’s IRTF is a hybrid firm-fixed-price contract with an indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity provision. The contract has a maximum potential value of approximately $85.5 million, with a base […]

title: NASA Announces Winners of Inaugural Human Lander Challenge
summary: NASA’s 2024 Human Lander Challenge (HuLC) Forum brought 12 university teams from across the United States to Huntsville, Alabama, near the agency’s Marshall Space Flight Center, to showcase their innovative concepts for addressing the complex issue of managing lunar dust. The 12 finalists, selected in March 2024, presented their final presentations to a panel of […]

title: Boeing delays Starliner return by ‘weeks’ for testing, NASA says astronauts aren’t stranded
summary: NASA and Boeing are further extending the first Starliner crewed flight but are not yet setting a new target date for returning the capsule to Earth, the organizations announced on Friday.

title: The Maze is Afoot
summary: This labyrinth – with a silhouette of the fictional detective Sherlock Holmes at its center – is used as a calibration target for the cameras and laser that are part of SHERLOC (Scanning Habitable Environments with Raman & Luminescence for Organics and Chemicals), one of the instruments aboard NASA’s Perseverance Mars rover. The image was […]
